intro: Calycorectes paranaensis, commonly known as the Paranaensis calycorectes, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique floral structure. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, with a distinctive calyx that remains attached to the fruit. Calycorectes paranaensis is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
